snippet: Corrections appearing in print on September 13, 2012.
Apple has made some alterations in its new smartphone, including its shape and its headphones.
abstract: Apple makes several significant design changes in its new iPhone 5; new features noted.

snippet: The iPhone 5 has a new connector on the phone’s base that instantly renders all accessories and chargers obsolete. An adapter that will work with many, but not all, current accessories starts at $30.
abstract: Apple's new iPhone 5 has a new connector on phone’s base, called the Lightning port, that instantly renders all accessories and chargers obsolete; adapter that will work with many, but not all, current accessories starts at $30; connector could be a boon to the hundreds of companies that sell accessories for iPhones and iPads.

headline.main: Design Thrills Apple’s Partners, but Will Cost Users
headline.print_headline: Design Thrills Apple’s Partners, but Will Cost Users

snippet: A digital-to-analog converter can help your music sound much more as if it were live.
abstract: Tool Kit column highlights digital-to-analog converters for sound systems that are priced starting at $300.

headline.main: A Sound System as Resonant as a Concert Hall
headline.print_headline: A Sound System as Resonant as a Concert Hall

snippet: Bigger screen, longer battery life, more sophisticated camera, better sound. Overall, Apple seems to have put its focus on the important things you want in an app phone. David Pogue, technology columnist for The New York Times, gives his first imp...
abstract: Bigger screen, longer battery life, more sophisticated camera, better sound. Overall, Apple seems to have put its focus on the important things you want in an app phone. David Pogue, technology columnist for The New York Times, gives his first impressions.

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes why writing for the Web requires more clarity and brevity, not less; an app that gives you information it thi...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes why writing for the Web requires more clarity and brevity, not less; an app that gives you information it thinks you will need based on the context of your conversation; and a report about working at a Foxconn plant in China.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Inside Foxconn, and Technology's Limits

snippet: Bigger screen, longer battery life, more sophisticated camera, better sound. Overall, Apple seems to have put its focus on the important things you want in an app phone.
abstract: Bigger screen, longer battery life, more sophisticated camera, better sound. Overall, Apple seems to have put its focus on the important things you want in an app phone.

snippet: Apple introduces the iPhone 5. Also, bionic suits help paraplegics walk again and a look at nostalgic apps.
abstract: Apple introduces the iPhone 5. Also, bionic suits help paraplegics walk again and a look at nostalgic apps.

snippet: Apple introduces the iPhone 5. | Bionic suits help paraplegics walk again. | Nostalgic apps.

byline.original: Emily B. Hager, Sean Patrick Farrell, David Frank and Pedro Rosado

snippet: The new version also requires a new connector cord — and a new adapter to make it work with existing accessories.
abstract: Apple unveils its new iPhone 5, with a larger, four-inch screen, faster wireless Internet speeds and a more powerful chip than its previous iPhone 4S; it is 18 percent thinner and 20 percent lighter.

headline.main: Apple Unveils an iPhone That Is Lighter and More Powerful
headline.print_headline: Apple Unveils an iPhone That Is Lighter and More Powerful
